The modules simply refuse to zero, with the smartdashboard values for angle reading not zero. The modules will sometimes turn to a new “0”, but it still won’t read zero or be facing straight. This is the bane of my existence. MK4i swerve with thrifty encoders and NEOs.

posts.name: Abdullah Khaled
posts.cooked:
One thing that I noticed in your code is that you’re not considering the gear ratio between the encoder (which I presume is on the same shaft as the wheel) and the motor. Since the ThriftyBot encoder outputs a value from 0 to 1, instead of multiplying the value by tau (2 * pi), you would multiply it by the gear ratio of your turn motor to the output shaft (Your kTurningMotorReduction ). Your offset would be within 0 to kTurningMotorReduction instead of in radians, but that way it should correspond to how much the motor actually needs to turn to reach that positon. One other thing that I would check is that your motors and encoder wires are going to the correct place (we might have spent a bit too much time trying to diagnose the issue before we did that ).

DISCLAIMER: Our team is using Krakens instead of Neos, but we are also using ThriftyBot encoders on our swerve. My observations are based on what our team found was causing troubles with our swerve, but since I don’t have much experience with REV I don’t know if this will help (I hope it does though!).

posts.name: icemannie
posts.cooked:
the Math.Util instruction changes it into ± Math.PI range That will be where the negative offsets are happening. The AnalogEncoder just returns between 0 and 1.

Try return position; instead of the MathUtil calculation You will need to redo offsets because they will all be positive now.
yeah, I did diagnose that, it just isn’t pushed yet. is it possible that this is the cause of the non-zeroing?
